meanings.definition: Covered with or having many brambles
meanings.sent1: The path through the forest became bramblier as we ventured deeper into the woods.
meanings.sent2: Her garden was bramblier than the others, with thorny bushes growing everywhere.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the bramblier sections of the hedge felt like solving a prickly puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned house looked bramblier than ever, with vines creeping up its walls like thorny fingers.
meanings.sent5: The bramblier the bushes, the more cautious the hikers had to be to avoid getting scratched.

meanings.sent1: The fabric of her dress had a bramblier texture, similar to the roughness of thorny bushes.
meanings.sent2: His handwriting was bramblier than usual, with loops and swirls that resembled tangled vines.
meanings.sent3: The bramblier pattern on the wallpaper gave the room a rustic and natural feel.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, tousled from the wind, looked bramblier than ever, with strands sticking out in all directions like prickly branches.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the bramblier essence of the forest in his painting, with intricate details of twisted branches and thorns.
